channel.title: Setting Up Classpath and Path on Vista x64
channel.description:
Hi guys,
You see this as my first post and say "lol wut a nub", when I have lurked around the forums for over 2 years(lost my old account). I quit rs private servers when I bought an Xbox 360(which was the same time I quit RS as well). But now sadly, my Xbox has RRoD'd(Red ring of death, google it). Now I'm back and with a new "super" computer(2.8ghz dual core amd 64, 4gb OCZ 800mhz, 9800gtx). Its not the best but it gets the job done.
Now for my question, I'm running Windows Vista Home Premium 64 bit and am having trouble setting up the Variables. I've got JDK 6 update 12 installed and have set the variable to [code]Classpath=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;%CLASSPATH% [/code] and [code] %SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files (x86)\Universal Extractor;C:\Program Files (x86)\Universal Extractor\bin;C:\Program Files (x86)\QuickTime\QTSystem\;C:\Program Files (x86)\Smart Projects\IsoBuster;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin; [/code]
My JDK installed to [Code] C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\ [/code] The version is the windows x64 version.
My guess is that there are some differences in the 32 and 64 bit versions. I don't know whats in the 32 bit package but I went to the \bin folder and there is nothing named classpath.
Any and all comments/help is appreciated,
Gflo
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Apparently it wasn't my problem [code] @echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" loader.java pause [/code]
Found that in the compiler
note the 07

item.title: Setting Up Classpath and Path on Vista x64
item.dc:creator: @Gflo Gflo
item.description:
@Gflo wrote:

Hi guys,

You see this as my first post and say “lol wut a nub”, when I have lurked around the forums for over 2 years(lost my old account). I quit rs private servers when I bought an Xbox 360(which was the same time I quit RS as well). But now sadly, my Xbox has RRoD’d(Red ring of death, google it). Now I’m back and with a new “super” computer(2.8ghz dual core amd 64, 4gb OCZ 800mhz, 9800gtx). Its not the best but it gets the job done.

Now for my question, I’m running Windows Vista Home Premium 64 bit and am having trouble setting up the Variables. I’ve got JDK 6 update 12 installed and have set the variable to

Classpath=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;%CLASSPATH%
and

%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files (x86)\Universal Extractor;C:\Program Files (x86)\Universal Extractor\bin;C:\Program Files (x86)\QuickTime\QTSystem\;C:\Program Files (x86)\Smart Projects\IsoBuster;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin;

My JDK installed to

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\

The version is the windows x64 version.

My guess is that there are some differences in the 32 and 64 bit versions. I don’t know whats in the 32 bit package but I went to the \bin folder and there is nothing named classpath.

Any and all comments/help is appreciated,

Gflo

Apparently it wasn’t my problem

@echo off
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" loader.java
pause

Found that in the compiler

note the 07

Read full topic
item.source: Setting Up Classpath and Path on Vista x64
